intro: Thesium transsilvanicum, commonly known as the Transylvanian thesium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Southeastern Europe. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in early summer. Its leaves are narrow and evergreen, and it thrives in acidic, well-drained soils. Thesium transsilvanicum is often found in forest understories and rocky habitats.
